  • Exports

Nim wrapper for WebUI

Author:Jasmine
WebUI Version:2.3.0

See: https://neroist.github.io/webui-docs/

Imports

webui/bindings

Types

Event = ref object
  internalImpl*: ptr bindings.Event
When you use bind(), your application will receive an event every time the user clicks on the specified HTML element. The event comes with the element_name, which is The HTML ID of the clicked element, for example, MyButton, MyInput, etc. The event also comes with the WebUI unique element ID & the unique window ID. 
Window = distinct int

Procs

proc `bind`(win: Window; element: string; func: proc (e: Event)) {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Bind a specific html element click event with a function. Empty element means all events. 
proc `bind`(win: Window; element: string; func: proc (e: Event): bool) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Bind func to element element and automatically pass return value of func to Javascript

    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc `bind`(win: Window; element: string; func: proc (e: Event): string) {.
    ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc close(win: Window) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Close a specific window only. The window object will still exist. 
proc data(e: Event): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc decode(str: string): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Base64 decoding. Use this to safely decode received Base64 text from the UI. If it fails it will return an empty string. 
proc destroy(win: Window) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Close a specific window and free all memory resources. 
proc element(e: Event): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc encode(str: string): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Base64 encoding. Use this to safely send text based data to the UI. If it fails it will return an empty string. 
proc eventNumber(e: Event): int {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc eventType(e: Event): bindings.Events {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
proc exit() {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Close all opened windows. wait() will break. 
proc free(ptr: pointer): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Safely free a buffer allocated by WebUI, for example when using encode(). 
proc getBool(e: Event): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Parse argument as a boolean.

Parse argument as a integer.

proc getString(e: Event): string {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

proc icon=(win: Window; icon, type: string) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Set the default embedded HTML favicon

Set the window in Kiosk mode (Full screen) 
proc multiAccess=(win: Window; status: bool) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Allow the window URL to be re-used in normal web browsers

Return the response to JavaScript as a boolean. 
proc returnInt(e: Event; n: int) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Return the response to JavaScript as a string. 
proc run(win: Window; script: string) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Run JavaScript quickly without waiting for the response. 
proc runtime=(win: Window; runtime: bindings.Runtime) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Chose between Deno and NodeJS runtime for .js and .ts files. 
proc script(win: Window; script: string; timeout: int = 0;
            bufferLen: static[int] = 1024 * 8): tuple[data: string, error: bool]
Run Javascript code script and return the result 
proc setTimeout(timeout: int) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Set the maximum time in seconds to wait for browser to start

Set timeout to 0 to wait forever.

proc show(win: Window; content: string): bool {.discardable, ...raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}

Show Window win. If the window is already shown, the UI will get refreshed in the same window.

content can be a file name, or a static HTML script.

proc show(win: Window; content: string; browser: bindings.Browsers): bool {.
    discardable, ...raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Same as show(), but with a specific web browser. 
proc shown(win: Window): bool {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Return if window win is still running 
proc wait() {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Wait until all opened windows get closed. 
proc window(e: Event): Window {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
